enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Req: Students must have taken CIV ENV 221 in order to enroll in this class.
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 325-0-20 Reinforced Concrete

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: COURSE DESCRIPTION / Fundamentals of reinforced concrete theory and design. Analysis and design of beams, slabs and columns. Concurrent familiarization with current building codes, specifications and practices.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: CIV_ENV 221, Theory of Structures I, or equivalent.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Upon completion of the course the students should:
1) Describe the requirements of a properly designed reinforced concrete structure
2) Describe the methodologies that govern strength design
3) Complete bending moment design of a flexural element.
4) Complete shear design of a flexural element.
5) Complete design of a beam-column using interaction relationships
6) Complete a simple footing design
7) Conduct simple concrete strength tests
8) Able to present design calculations in a professional manner

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
CLASS SCHEDULE / three 50-minutes lectures and one 80-minutes lecture/lab.

COMPUTER USAGE / Spread sheets or structural analysis software

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Reinforced Concrete: Mechanics and Design / J. K. Wright and J. G. McGregor / ISBN: 978-0132176521 / 2011 / 6th / Prentice Hall
